title: [wishlist]: rerun --print
body:
NB Please pardon me if there is an issue already - I feel like I have expressed my desires before but can't find it

Quite a few times already I needed to rerun a modified version of previously `datalad run` command.  ATM I see no way to easily obtain a command line invocation I should use/modify from a json record recorded in the history. E.g. what I want is having a record like

```shell
$> git show
commit 7ce688353f1f790964fcb0c0fb5d7cc77301d6ee (HEAD -> master)
Author: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 24 10:59:34 2019 -0400

    [DATALAD RUNCMD] bash -c 'md5sum urls.csv > MD5SUMS'
    
    === Do not change lines below ===
    {
     "chain": [],
     "cmd": "bash -c 'md5sum {inputs} > {outputs}'",
     "dsid": "9a647e72-ad54-11e9-95c1-8019340ce7f2",
     "exit": 0,
     "extra_inputs": [],
     "inputs": [
      "urls.csv"
     ],
     "outputs": [
      "MD5SUMS"
     ],
     "pwd": "."
    }
    ^^^ Do not change lines above ^^^
```

to be able to get something like
```shell
$ datalad rerun --print 
datalad run --explicit --input urls.csv --output MD5SUMS bash -c 'md5sum {inputs} > {outputs}'
```
so I could copy/paste and modify to my liking for the next `datalad run` call.

Additional desires
- [ ] If original `datalad run` was executed somewhere from a super dataset, inform user about it.  Ideally inspect super datasets to match `dsid` and tell from which path it was/should be ran, e.g.

```shell
$ datalad rerun --print 
cd ../..
datalad run --explicit --input urls.csv --output MD5SUMS bash -c 'md5sum {inputs} > {outputs}'
```

- [ ] `--print` could either become `--print-cmdline` or become "smart" to print Python invocation when invoked from within Python
